intro: Microsaccus borneensis, commonly known as the Bornean microsaccus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It grows as an herbaceous perennial, often found in shaded, moist undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
